channel.description: Recent content in Joel Mackenzie on Joel Mackenzie

item.title: Recruitment
item.description:
Information for Prospective Students

Please carefully read all of the following information before contacting me.

Available Positions

Currently, I do not have any funded positions open. However, there are positions available for one or more outstanding applicants who qualify for an international scholarship through UQ, or an Australian government Research Training Scholarship position. These scholarships are extremely competitive, but possible to get if you have strong evidence of research ability. Please get in touch with me if you think you may qualify for either of these programs and are interested in working with me.

I am available for supervision of honours or masters students at UQ.

Key Selection Criteria

Candidates for a PhD program should have at least one of the following:

  • A first class honours degree in Computer Science or an adjacent field such as Mathematics or Electrical Engineering from an Australian University;

  • Rank in the top 20% of the class and attend a good national university;

  • Rank in the top 30% of the class and attend a top 50 university; or

  • Have a publication in an information retrieval or algorithms conference or journal such as SIGIR, WSDM, ECIR, WWW, SIGKDD, SIGMOD, VLDB, TKDE, EMNLP, ACL, TOIS, …

In addition, it is useful to have any of the following:

  • Top programming ability, especially in systems languages like C, C++, or Rust, as evidenced by a portfolio such as a Github account;

  • A recommendation letter from a well respected academic in the field; or

  • Suitable industry experience in the project area.

How to Apply

The best thing to do is to send me an email with a brief sketch of who you are, why you want to pursue a research career, what you’d like to work on, and how you think our interests align. You can include your CV, any appropriate publications or links to portfolios, academic transcripts, and so on. Please try to keep the email short and aim to address the selection criteria above.

item.title: Supervision
item.description:
PhD Students

  • Watheq Mansour (primary advisor, current): Efficient and Effective Data Augmentation Strategies for Information Retrieval.

  • Daisuke Yukita (associate advisor, current): Human-centered Verification of Large Language Model Outputs.

  • Farid Ariai (associate advisor, current): Towards Multi-Jurisdictional Legal NLP Systems.

  • Pietro Bernardelle (associate advisor, current): Leveraging Personas to Study and Control Ideological Biases in Large Language Models.

  • Zhixuan Li (associate advisor, current): TBA.

  • Dr Shengyao Zhuang (associate advisor, graduated 2023): Teaching Pre-Trained Language Models to Rank Effectively, Efficiently, and Robustly.

Masters Students

  • Stefano Civelli (associate advisor, current): Political Bias in Large Language Models for Content Moderation: a Persona-based Perspective.

  • Chuting Yu (associate advisor, current): TBA.

Honours Students

  • Bill Rule (current): Fast, Compact, and Dynamic Indexing for Learned Sparse Retrieval Systems.

  • Charlotte Pietsch (graduated 2024): Revisiting Impact-Based Index Structures for Efficient Ranking.

  • Zhixuan Li (graduated 2024): Exploring Batch Query Processing for Web Search.

Potential Students

If you are interested in working with me and wish to pursue a higher degree by research, please read the information on my recruiting page to find out more about selection criteria and how to apply.

item.title: Teaching
item.description:
The University of Queensland

I was the course coordinator and lecturer for COMP3506/COMP7505: Algorithms & Data Structures during semester 2, 2023, 2024, and 2025. In 2025, I co-lectured this course with Dr Joshua Arnold.

I was the course coordinator and lecturer for CSSE7610: Concurrency: Theory and Practice with Brae Webb in semester 2, 2025.

I was the course coordinator and lecturer for DATA7001: Introduction to Data Science with Dr Xin Guo during semester 1, 2023.

I was the course coordinator and lecturer for INFS3200: Advanced Database Systems at the University of Queensland during Semester 2, 2022.

RMIT University

I have previously been a tutor and/or a lab assistant for the following courses at RMIT University:

  • COSC1105/COSC1007: Computing Theory
  • COSC2406/COSC2407: Database Systems
  • COSC1112/COSC1114: Operating Systems Principles
  • ISYS1078/ISYS1079: Information Retrieval
  • COSC2531: Programming Fundamentals (Head Tutor)

item.title: ICTIR 2021
item.description: Our paper ERR is not C/W/L: Exploring the Relationship Between Expected Reciprocal Rank and Other Metrics has won the best paper award at ICTIR 2021!

item.title: Service
item.description:
Organisation

I was a short paper co-chair for SIGIR 2025 with Ebrahim Bagheri and Faegheh Hasibi which was held in Padua, Italy.

I was a program co-chair for ADCS 2022 with Maciek Rybinski which was held at Flinders University in Adelaide.

Damiano Spina and I were the general chairs of ADCS 2021 which was held as a virtual seminar series.

I was the demo track chair for SIGIR 2024 with Suzan Verberne.

I was the proceedings chair for WSDM 2019, CHIIR 2021, SIGIR-AP 2023 (with Johanne Trippas), and CHIIR2025.

I was a co-organiser of the Workshop on Reaching Efficiency in Neural IR at SIGIR 2023 and SIGIR 2024.

I am a co-organiser of the Workshop on Agentic AI in Financial Services at AAAI 2026.

Peer Reviewing

I have been a PC/SPC member for a range of conferences, journals, workshops. Please see my CV for more details.
